title: Vehicle Hits Crowd in LA, 30 Injured; Driver Shot, Unconscious
snippets: A vehicle rammed into a crowd of people waiting to enter a nightclub along a busy boulevard in Los Angeles early Saturday, injuring 30 people and leading bystanders to attack the driver, authorities said.
At least three were in critical condition after being injured along Santa Monica Boulevard in East Hollywood, the Fire Department said in a statement.
A Los Angeles Fire Department Official told reporters it appeared the person behind the wheel became unconscious while driving.

LOS ANGELES (AP) — A vehicle rammed into a crowd of people waiting to enter a nightclub along a busy boulevard in Los Angeles early Saturday, injuring 30 people and leading bystanders to attack the driver, authorities said. The driver was later found to have been shot, according to Los Angeles polic

The incident occurred early Saturday. Bystanders attacked the driver, who was later found to have been shot. Authorities suggest the driver may have become unconscious while driving.

title: Bank of Canada Holds Rate at 2.75% Amid US Tariff Concerns
snippets: After a quarter-point cut in March, the Bank of Canada held its benchmark interest rate steady at 2.75 per cent in April and June.

OTTAWA — The Bank of Canada has largely kept to the sidelines as it tries to get a sense of how U.S. tariffs will impact the economy — and some economists think it might just stay there. After a quarter-point cut in March, the central bank held its benchmark interest rate steady at 2.75
titles: Here’s why the Bank of Canada could be done cutting interest rates for now
Why the Bank of Canada could be done cutting its policy rate for now
summary: The Bank of Canada maintained its benchmark interest rate at 2.75% during April and June, following a quarter-point reduction in March. This decision reflects the central bank's cautious approach amid uncertainties surrounding the impact of U.S. tariffs on the economy. Some economists anticipate that the Bank of Canada might maintain this rate for the foreseeable future due to these economic concerns.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about the Bank of Canada's interest rates and the potential impact of U.S. tariffs on the economy. It offers insight into the central bank's cautious approach and provides some context about the economic concerns that might influence future decisions. However, it does not clearly highlight any solutions or improvements.
